Problem:
Consider a system expressed by the linear transformation \\( T(x) = Ax \\) where \\( A \\) is a constant matrix. We explore the effect of an additional functional transformation \\( g(x) = Ux \\), where \\( U \\) is a unitary matrix, on the eigenvalues of the vector \\( x \\).

Can we deduce the original vector \\( x_0 \\) at t = 0 after observing \\( x(t) \\) at t = T without knowing whether \\( g(x) \\) was applied?
Explanation: Without information on the application of \\( g(x) \\), and knowing that \\( U \\) can fundamentally change the vector \\( x_0 \\) while preserving eigenvalues, it is impossible to uniquely determine \\( x_0 \\) from \\( x(t) \\) because multiple vectors with altered directions can share the same eigenvalues.
